alert.note: Alert for Gentry; Harrison; Worth (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 12 at 4:50AM CDT until August 12 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Missouri and northwest Missouri, including the following counties, in north central Missouri, Harrison. In northwest Missouri, Gentry and Worth. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 4 and 8.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bethany, Albany, Grant City, Ridgeway, Gilman City, Eagleville, New Hampton, Cainsville, Irena, Blythedale, Mount Moriah, Allendale, Denver, Martinsville and Hatfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
